content: What 1993 film, starring Bill Murray, shares its name with a popular annual holiday in the United States and is centered around an ironic time loop?

I believe the film you're referring to is "Groundhog Day," which was released in 1993 and stars Bill Murray. The movie revolves around a weatherman who finds himself living the same day over and over again, specifically on Groundhog Day, which is an annual holiday in the United States. The plot involves Murray's character, Phil Connors, experiencing an ironic time loop where he relives February 2nd repeatedly until he can improve himself and break the cycle. This unique premise has made "Groundhog Day" a cult classic and a favorite among fans of comedy and philosophy.
